subject: Gardening
title: Suzhou: Venice of the East
description: A quick win: understand Suzhou: Venice of the East.

hook.text: Suzhou once had over 200 private gardens. Nine surviving ones are now UNESCO World Heritage Sites.

buildup.text: Wealthy scholar-officials built private retreats combining rock formations, water, pavilions, and living plants.

discovery.text: The Humble Administrator's Gardenâ€”the largestâ€”uses borrowed scenery. Distant pagodas become part of the view.

twist.text: Each garden was meant to be experienced sequentially. Paths choreograph surprisesâ€”a hidden view, a sudden opening.

climax.text: Suzhou gardens are three-dimensional poems. Every window frame is a painting. Every turn reveals a new stanza.

punchline.text: In Suzhou, walking through a garden is reading art.

quiz.question: What is 'borrowed scenery' in Suzhou garden design?
options: Using mirrors to create the illusion of larger spaces
Incorporating distant views outside the garden as part of its design
Transplanting mature trees from other gardens
